item.description:
With Joseph Carringer

This workshop includes:
• A brief history of the didgeridoo
• Discussion of the Chakra system (with handouts)
• Brief comparison of Traditional Chinese Medicine Dan Tiens & Meridians
• Individual meditations played to the key of all 7 major Chakras
• Time for processing and Q&A

Participants are encouraged to bring meditation oils of their preference.

Joseph Carringer has been playing an Australian Aboriginal didgeridoo for over a decade and a half, using it as a deep meditative tool in his personal shamanic journey as well as a therapeutic instrument for his clients. Joseph also incorporates a unique combination of Traditional Chinese Medicine philosophy, Ayurvedic Chakra philosophy and Traditional Shamanic Healing techniques into his sound therapy practice.

Joseph Carringer has a complete keyed set of concert class aboriginal eucalyptus didgeridoos in each note of the chakra system. These didgeridoos allow him to perform full chakra clearing meditations and/or use them in unique combinations for specific styles of journeying, meditating and clearing.

Since the fall of 2005, Joseph has offered yearly classes for the Maine Medical CAM programs and the University of Southern Maine CAM programs and he continues to present at the University of New Hampshire and New England College.

Time: 7:00 - 8:30pm
item.name: Journeying Through the Chakras
